project_description: A Flutter app that increments a counter by 10 using the Cubit pattern for state management.
architecture_overview: The project follows a modular structure with separate folders for screens, cubits, models, and widgets. State management is handled using the Cubit pattern.

files.name: lib/main.dart
files.description: Entry point of the application. Provides all necessary Cubits using BlocProvider.

files.name: lib/screens/home_screen.dart
files.description: Displays the home screen with the counter and increment button.

files.name: lib/cubits/counter_cubit.dart
files.description: Cubit that manages the state of the counter.

files.name: lib/cubits/counter_state.dart
files.description: Defines the state of the counter.

files.name: lib/widgets/counter_display.dart
files.description: Widget that displays the counter value.

widgets.name: HomeScreen
widgets.description: Displays the home screen with the counter and increment button.

widgets.name: CounterDisplay
widgets.description: Widget that displays the counter value.

cubits.name: CounterCubit
cubits.description: Cubit that manages the state of the counter.

dependencies.name: flutter
dependencies.purpose: Flutter framework for building the UI.

sequence_diagram:
@startuml
actor User
User -> HomeScreen : open app
HomeScreen -> BlocProvider : provide CounterCubit
User -> HomeScreen : tap increment button
HomeScreen -> CounterCubit : increment()
CounterCubit -> CounterState : update state
CounterState -> CounterDisplay : display new value
@enduml
state_management_flow: State is managed using the Cubit pattern. The CounterCubit handles the increment logic and updates the CounterState. The UI listens to state changes and rebuilds accordingly.
navigation_flow: The app has a single screen (HomeScreen) that displays the counter and an increment button.
